snippet: In one of the Drug Enforcement Administration’s largest seizures, federal agents confiscated nearly 155 pounds of the drug, with an estimated street value of $50 million.
abstract: Drug Enforcement Agency raids Bronx apartment, seizing nearly 155 pounds of heroin with estimated street value of $50 million; smuggling operation, with ties to area of Mexico controlled by Sinaloa Cartel, had been receiving large shipments since 2013.

byline.contributor: Kate Pastor contributed reporting, and Alain Delaquérière contributed research.

lead_paragraph: In one of the Drug Enforcement Administration’s largest seizures, federal agents confiscated nearly 155 pounds of the drug, with an estimated street value of $50 million.

headline.main: U.S. Says It Disrupted Major Heroin-Importing Operation in Bronx
headline.print_headline: U.S. Says It Disrupted Major Heroin-Importing Operation in Bronx
